intro: Conostylis aculeata subsp. breviflora, commonly known as the narrow-flowered conostylis, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in dense spikes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
